text:
It generates an empty list which will fail drastically while trying to concatenate empty list of extracted regions.

One solution would be to warn for no regions are extracted and return the same empty mask/image.

text:
Random Walker just returns the same if no markers are found. Probably, yes this might happen failing to find peak extraction.

There are also many cases to consider as well such as: threshold, min_region_size, n_subjects and components. So, I found warning and empty returns would be reasonable. But, pipeline chaining makes life hard again. Failing again at some point.

In large data setting, this might not be the case.

text:
> Maybe the special case should be done in the RegionExtractor, and not the random walker?

No, not in random walker.

> Also, in the logic of the function of RegionExtractor, I don't fully understand why it's a problem that one of the maps gives rise to no regions.

Giving rise to no regions will not be a problem. It would concatenate the image no matter it has regions in it or not.

But concatenation fails when there are no images at all, empty list is provided. This empty list is been generated by the fact that given components image has no information at all (lets say empty) though it seems like components in it. This is what I am experiencing now when trying to test my pipeline on small usecase (n_subjects=1).

This issue is a very rare case just want to fix it with meaningful error message or warnings returned with empty list as it is.
